snippet: The Mets and their chief operating officer, in court papers filed Friday, denied accusations made in a lawsuit by a former senior ticket-sales executive who said that she had been discriminated against for being pregnant out of wedlock.
abstract: New York Mets and chief operating officer Jeff Wilpon file court documents denying accusations made in lawsuit by former executive Leigh Castergine that she had been fired because she complained about discriminatory treatment over her pregnancy to team's human resources department.
lead_paragraph: The Mets and their chief operating officer, in court papers filed Friday, denied accusations made in a lawsuit by a former senior ticket-sales executive who said that she had been discriminated against for being pregnant out of wedlock.

headline.main: Mets Deny Bias in Ticket Official’s Firing
headline.print_headline: Mets Deny Bias in Ticket Official’s Firing
